snippet: Undergraduates described a culture of sharing notes and materials for a course that once had a reputation for being easy, but whose tests had become confusing.
abstract: Harvard students suspected in a major cheating scandal say that many of the accusations are based on innocent collaboration among students in a class with confusing material and contradicting signals between the professor and teaching assistants; some students say they will sue the university if harsh punishments, like suspensions or revocation of diplomas, are meted out.
lead_paragraph: Undergraduates described a culture of sharing notes and materials for a course that once had a reputation for being easy, but whose tests had become confusing.

headline.seo: Students of Harvard Cheating Scandal Say Group Work Was Accepted
headline.main: Harvard Students in Cheating Scandal Say Collaboration Was Accepted
headline.print_headline: Harvard Students in Cheating Scandal Say Collaboration Was Accepted
